title: ICCV_2001_47_abs

sentences.text: We propose to incorporate a priori geometric constraints in a 3 -- D stereo reconstruction scheme to cope with the many cases where image information alone is not sufficient to accurately recover 3 -- D shape .
Our approach is based on the iterative deformation of a 3 -- D surface mesh to minimize an objective function .
We show that combining anisotropic meshing with a non-quadratic approach to regularization enables us to obtain satisfactory reconstruction results using triangulations with few vertices .
Structural or numerical constraints can then be added locally to the reconstruction process through a constrained optimization scheme .
They improve the reconstruction results and enforce their consistency with a priori knowledge about object shape .
The strong description and modeling properties of differential features make them useful tools that can be efficiently used as constraints for 3 -- D reconstruction .

summary: We propose to incorporate a priori geometric constraints in a 3 -- D stereo reconstruction scheme to cope with the many cases where image information alone is not sufficient to accurately recover 3 -- D shape . Our approach is based on the iterative deformation of a 3 -- D surface mesh to minimize an objective function . We show that combining anisotropic meshing with a non-quadratic approach to regularization enables us to obtain satisfactory reconstruction results using triangulations with few vertices . Structural or numerical constraints can then be added locally to the reconstruction process through a constrained optimization scheme . They improve the reconstruction results and enforce their consistency with a priori knowledge about object shape . The strong description and modeling properties of differential features make them useful tools that can be efficiently used as constraints for 3 -- D reconstruction .

Predicate-propose_to_incorporate.label: propose to incorporate
Predicate-propose_to_incorporate.description: To propose to incorporate means to suggest or recommend the integration of something (e.g. concepts, principles, rules) into a larger framework, system, or structure. This predicate indicates that the subject intends to bring together disparate elements to form a cohesive whole, often with the goal of creating a new entity or enhancing an existing one.

Predicate-to_incorporate.label: to incorporate
Predicate-to_incorporate.description: To incorporate refers to the act of integrating or merging one thing into another, often implying a harmonious union. This predicate connects the subject (the proposer) with an object that represents the entity being incorporated, suggesting a deliberate and intentional process of assimilation.

Predicate-is_based_on.label: is based on
Predicate-is_based_on.description: The predicate 'is based on' indicates that the subject relies on or has its foundation in the object. It suggests a relationship where the subject derives its principles, methods, or justification from the object.

Predicate-minimize.label: minimize
Predicate-minimize.description: To minimize means to reduce or decrease something (typically a quantity or magnitude) as much as possible. In this context, it indicates that the subject's goal is to bring down or lower the value of the object, often with the intention of achieving an optimal state.

Predicate-can_be_added_locally_to.label: can be added locally to
Predicate-can_be_added_locally_to.description: This predicate indicates that a specific element (the subject) has the ability to be incorporated into another entity (the object), typically in a manner that does not require significant changes or reorganization of the overall structure. The incorporation can occur at a local level, without affecting other parts of the system or process.

Predicate-improve.label: improve
Predicate-improve.description: To 'improve' means to enhance or increase the quality, effectiveness, or value of something. It implies a positive change or enhancement in the object's state, often resulting from intentional effort or action by the subject.

Predicate-enables.label: enables
Predicate-enables.description: The predicate 'enables' indicates that the subject has the capability or authority to facilitate, permit, or make possible the occurrence of the object. It suggests a causal relationship where the subject's action or state allows for or brings about the existence or effectiveness of the object.

Predicate-enforce_their_consistency.label: enforce their consistency
Predicate-enforce_their_consistency.description: To ensure that the subject's behavior or properties align with its expected characteristics or standards, thereby maintaining coherence and accuracy.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a specific instance or example of a more general category or concept represented by the object. It establishes a hierarchical relationship between the two, where the subject is a narrower or more specialized form of the object.
